Doc: Provides information about how the information in this message is applicable to a regulatory reporting process.

Source.Contents:
/#
   Provides information about how the information in this message is applicable to a regulatory reporting process.
 #/
record FpML5.reporting.ReportingRegime {
  # Identifies the reporting regime under which this data is reported. For example, Dodd-Frank, MiFID, HongKongOTCDRepository, ODRF
  name : string

  # Identifies the specific regulator or other supervisory body for which this data is produced. For example, CFTC, SEC, UKFSA, ODRF, SFC, ESMA.
  supervisorRegistration : FpML5.reporting.SupervisorRegistration

  # Identifies the role of this party in reporting this trade for this regulator; roles could include ReportingParty and Voluntary reporting.
  reportingRole : string?

  # The reason this message is being sent, for example Snapshot, PET, Confirmation, RealTimePublic.
  reportingPurpose : string?

  # Whether the particular trade type in question is required by this regulator to be cleared.
  mandatorilyClearable : string?

  # Whether the particular product must be executed on a SEF or DCM. See to Dodd-Frank section 723(a)(8).
  mandatoryFacilityExecution : boolean?

  # Specifies whether the party invoked exception to not execute the trade on facility such as SEF and DCM even though the particular product is mandated to execute on a SEF.
  mandatoryFacilityExecutionException : boolean?

  # Provides supporting evidence when a party invoked exception to not execute the trade on facility such as SEF and DCM even though the particular product is mandated to execute on a SEF.
  mandatoryFacilityExecutionExceptionDeclaration : FpML5.reporting.FacilityExecutionExceptionDeclaration?

  # Indicates whether the counterparty exceeds the volume threshold above which trades are required to be cleared.
  exceedsClearingThreshold : boolean?

  # Indicates the category or classification or business role of the organization referenced by the partyTradeInformation with respect to this reporting regime, for example Financial, NonFinancial etc.
  entityClassification : string

  # Indicates the category or classification or business role of a trade party with respect to this reporting regime, for example Financial, NonFinancial, Dealer, Non-Dealer, LocalParty, etc.
  partyEntityClassification : FpML5.reporting.PartyEntityClassification

  # Indicates how the parties to the trade (the counterparties) are related to each other with respect to this reporting regime, e.g. Affiliated, Intragroup, etc..
  tradePartyRelationshipType : string?

  # Reports a regulator-specific code for the action associated with this submission. Used, for example, to report the ESMA action type.
  actionType : string?

  # Reports that this trade was executed prior to the enactment of the relevant reporting regulation.
  preEnactmentTrade : boolean?

  # How the notional amount should be reported for the reporting regime. For example, for ESMA MiFIR it would be Nominal or MonetaryAmount.
  notionalType : string?

}

name.Doc: Identifies the reporting regime under which this data is reported. For example, Dodd-Frank, MiFID, HongKongOTCDRepository, ODRF
name.Name: name

supervisorRegistration.Doc: Identifies the specific regulator or other supervisory body for which this data is produced. For example, CFTC, SEC, UKFSA, ODRF, SFC, ESMA.
supervisorRegistration.Name: supervisorRegistration

reportingRole.Doc: Identifies the role of this party in reporting this trade for this regulator; roles could include ReportingParty and Voluntary reporting.
reportingRole.Name: reportingRole

reportingPurpose.Doc: The reason this message is being sent, for example Snapshot, PET, Confirmation, RealTimePublic.
reportingPurpose.Name: reportingPurpose

mandatorilyClearable.Doc: Whether the particular trade type in question is required by this regulator to be cleared.
mandatorilyClearable.Name: mandatorilyClearable

mandatoryFacilityExecution.Doc: Whether the particular product must be executed on a SEF or DCM. See to Dodd-Frank section 723(a)(8).
mandatoryFacilityExecution.Name: mandatoryFacilityExecution

mandatoryFacilityExecutionException.Doc: Specifies whether the party invoked exception to not execute the trade on facility such as SEF and DCM even though the particular product is mandated to execute on a SEF.
mandatoryFacilityExecutionException.Name: mandatoryFacilityExecutionException

mandatoryFacilityExecutionExceptionDecla.Doc: Provides supporting evidence when a party invoked exception to not execute the trade on facility such as SEF and DCM even though the particular product is mandated to execute on a SEF.
mandatoryFacilityExecutionExceptionDecla.Name: mandatoryFacilityExecutionExceptionDeclaration

exceedsClearingThreshold.Doc: Indicates whether the counterparty exceeds the volume threshold above which trades are required to be cleared.
exceedsClearingThreshold.Name: exceedsClearingThreshold

entityClassification.Doc: Indicates the category or classification or business role of the organization referenced by the partyTradeInformation with respect to this reporting regime, for example Financial, NonFinancial etc.
entityClassification.Name: entityClassification

partyEntityClassification.Doc: Indicates the category or classification or business role of a trade party with respect to this reporting regime, for example Financial, NonFinancial, Dealer, Non-Dealer, LocalParty, etc.
partyEntityClassification.Name: partyEntityClassification

tradePartyRelationshipType.Doc: Indicates how the parties to the trade (the counterparties) are related to each other with respect to this reporting regime, e.g. Affiliated, Intragroup, etc..
tradePartyRelationshipType.Name: tradePartyRelationshipType

actionType.Doc: Reports a regulator-specific code for the action associated with this submission. Used, for example, to report the ESMA action type.
actionType.Name: actionType

preEnactmentTrade.Doc: Reports that this trade was executed prior to the enactment of the relevant reporting regulation.
preEnactmentTrade.Name: preEnactmentTrade

notionalType.Doc: How the notional amount should be reported for the reporting regime. For example, for ESMA MiFIR it would be Nominal or MonetaryAmount.
notionalType.Name: notionalType
